Name: Amulet of Maihes
Description: Small faience amulet of the god Maihes, depicting him with lion head and human body, wearing the plumed and horned atef-crown. Maihes, the 'savage lion', was a deity who assisted the sun-god in his fight against the forces of chaos. The centre of his cult was at modern Tell el-Moqdam in the Nile Delta. Such small amulets were often strung on the body in mummification; the hole for the suspension cord may be seen behind the neck of the figure.
